articles.headline: In Russia, BP Sees a Second Act
articles.snippet: Reviled in the United States, the oil giant has mended its once-caustic relations with Russia at an opportune time.
articles.abstract: Reviled in the United States, the oil giant has mended its once-caustic relations with Russia at an opportune time.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW  Though its gushing well in the Gulf of Mexico is capped, BP seems doomed to years of hostile regulation and lawsuits in the United States.

articles.headline: Block on Minerals Called Threat to Japan’s Economy
articles.snippet: A standoff between China and Japan showed signs of a breakthrough after an official said new export licenses were issued.
articles.abstract: A standoff between China and Japan showed signs of a breakthrough after an official said new export licenses were issued.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  A halt of Chinese shipments of crucial industrial minerals to Japan poses a threat to the Japanese economy, a top Tokyo government official said Tuesday, amid a dispute over territorial sovereignty that has damaged relations between the regional rivals.

articles.headline: Generals in Pakistan Push for Shake-Up of Government
articles.snippet: The government’s handling of devastating floods and an economic crisis has laid bare deep tensions between the military and the civilian leadership.
articles.abstract: The government’s handling of devastating floods and an economic crisis has laid bare deep tensions between the military and the civilian leadership.
articles.lead_paragraph: ISLAMABAD, Pakistan  The Pakistani military, angered by the inept handling of the country’s devastating floods and alarmed by a collapse of the economy, is pushing for a shake-up of the elected government, and in the longer term, even the removal of President Asif Ali Zardari and his top lieutenants.

articles.headline: Toy Makers Fight for Exemption From Rules
articles.snippet: A federal crackdown on dangerous toys has swamped the safety commission with requests to exempt playthings.
articles.abstract: A federal crackdown on dangerous toys has swamped the safety commission with requests to exempt playthings.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is a football mainly for children? What about a Halloween costume or a model train?

articles.headline: After Recalls of Drugs, a Congressional Spotlight on J.& J.’s Chief
articles.snippet: In testimony on Thursday, William C. Weldon will seek to reassure the public after broad recalls, and defend his stewardship of the consumer products company.
articles.abstract: In testimony on Thursday, William C. Weldon will seek to reassure the public after broad recalls, and defend his stewardship of the consumer products company.
articles.lead_paragraph: In recent weeks, the chief executive of Johnson & Johnson has gone on the offensive in a very public way, trying to assure customers and company employees that the recalls of popular over-the-counter drugs like children’s liquid Tylenol did not reflect systemic problems across the corporation.
articles.byline: By Natasha Singer and Reed Abelson

articles.headline: U.S. Is Said to Seek Way to Sever Ties With A.I.G.
articles.snippet: The White House is said to be pressing for a deal to convert the government’s stake in A.I.G. into common stock and then sell it to private investors.
articles.abstract: The White House is said to be pressing for a deal to convert the government’s stake in A.I.G. into common stock and then sell it to private investors.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is pressing aggressively for a deal to end its support of the American International Group and hopes to have a completed plan to announce by next week, ahead of the midterm elections.
articles.byline: By Louise Story and Mary Williams Walsh

articles.headline: Likely Losses of House Seats in Midwest Stir Partisan Feuds
articles.snippet: In states expected to lose a seat in the coming reapportionment, the prospect of a new map has drawn extra notice — and a role in some campaigns.
articles.abstract: In states expected to lose a seat in the coming reapportionment, the prospect of a new map has drawn extra notice — and a role in some campaigns.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Whatever the outcome of the fall elections, one political loser this year seems certain: the Midwest.

articles.headline: Barnes & Noble Wins Battle Over Board
articles.snippet: After fending off a challenge to its chairman, the bookseller can now focus on a turnaround and a sale.
articles.abstract: After fending off a challenge to its chairman, the bookseller can now focus on a turnaround and a sale.
articles.lead_paragraph: The bookseller Barnes & Noble, after fending off a challenge to its chairman, can now focus on a turnaround and a sale.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Imagining a Deficit Plan From Republicans
articles.snippet: There’s a big difference between Republicans who have pledged to cut the deficit and true fiscal conservatives.
articles.abstract: There’s a big difference between Republicans who have pledged to cut the deficit and true fiscal conservatives.
